title: Attorney's fees
context: §662-12 Attorney&rsquo;s fees. The court rendering a judgment for the plaintiff pursuant to this chapter or the attorney general making a disposition pursuant to section 662-11 may, as a part of such judgment, award, or settlement, determine and allow reasonable attorney&rsquo;s fees which shall not, however, exceed twenty-five per cent of the amount recovered and shall be payable out of the judgment awarded to the plaintiff; provided that such limitation shall not include attorney&rsquo;s fees and costs that the court may award the plaintiff as a matter of its sanctions. [L 1957, c 312, pt of §1; Supp, §245A-12; HRS §662-12; am L 1979, c 152, §4] Case Notes Attorney&rsquo;s fee may be awarded in addition to judgment. 51 H. 540, 465 P.2d 580 (1970). Trial court has discretion in awarding attorney&rsquo;s fees. 54 H. 611, 513 P.2d 487 (1973). Mentioned: 76 H. 487, 879 P.2d 1070 (1994).
